context: The Estonian word 'osta' is the imperative form of the verb 'ostama', which means 'to buy' or 'to purchase'. It's used as a command or suggestion to someone to buy something. In different forms, this verb can be conjugated for various tenses and subjects - for example, 'ostan' (I buy), 'ostad' (you buy), 'ostab' (he/she/it buys).
